sen.j: 中村 梅雀（なかむら ばいじゃく）は、歌舞伎役者、ベーシスト。

sen.j: 2代目中村梅雀（にだいめ なかむら ばいじゃく、1955年（昭和30年）12月12日 -）は、日本の俳優。
sen.e: Baijaku NAKAMURA the Second (December 12, 1955 -) is a Japanese actor.
Baijaku NAKAMURA the Second (December 12, 1955 -) is a Japanese actor.

sen.j: 東京都立荻窪高等学校卒業後、桐朋学園芸術短期大学演劇専攻卒業。
sen.e: He graduated from Tokyo Metropolitan Ogikubo High School and the Drama Course at Toho Gakuen College of Drama and Music.

sen.j: 代々続く歌舞伎役者だが、テレビドラマや時代劇にも積極的に出演している。
sen.e: Although he is from the line of Kabuki actors, he actively appears on TV dramas and period drams.
Although he is from a line of Kabuki actors, he actively appears in TV dramas and period drams.

sen.j: 一度結婚に破れた後、2006年（平成18年）9月21日に、25歳の前進座女優瀬川寿子と再婚。
sen.e: After his first divorce, he got remarried to Hisako SEGAWA, who was an actress at Zenshinza (the Zenshinza Company) of 25 years old at the time, on September 21, 2006.
After his first divorce, he got remarried to 25-year-old Hisako SEGAWA, who was an actress at Zenshinza (the Zenshinza Company), on September 21, 2006.

sen.j: 1995年（平成7年）、NHK大河ドラマ『八代将軍吉宗』の徳川家重役（言語障害者）の怪演で知られる。
sen.e: His acting when he played Ieshige TOKUGAWA (a speech-disabled individual) for NHK's period drama "the Eighth Shogun Yoshimune" became legendary.
His portrayal of Ieshige TOKUGAWA (a speech-impaired individual) for the NHK period drama "The Eighth Shogun Yoshimune" is considered legendary.
His portrayal of Ieshige TOKUGAWA (a speech-impaired individual) for the NHK period drama "The Eighth Shogun Yoshimune" is considered legendary.

sen.j: 2006年、『功名が辻 (NHK大河ドラマ)』に徳川秀忠役で出演した。
sen.e: In 2006, he played Hidetada TOKUGAWA in a NHK's period drama "Komyogatsuji (Crossroads of a great achievement)."
In 2006, he played Hidetada TOKUGAWA in am NHK period drama entitled "Komyogatsuji (Crossroads of a Great Achievement)."
In 2006, he played Hidetada TOKUGAWA in an NHK period drama entitled "Komyo ga Tsuji" (Crossroads of the Achievement).
sen.cmt: am→an指示書の例では "Komyo ga Tsuji" (Crossroads of the Achievement) となっていますのでそれに従いました。

sen.j: この2作では、何れも、西田敏行と親子の役であった（八代将軍吉宗では西田＝父徳川吉宗役、梅雀＝長男家重役、功名が辻では、西田＝父徳川家康役、梅雀＝三男秀忠役）。
sen.e: In both of two TV dramas mentioned above, he plays a son of Toshiyuki NISHIDA (in "the Eighth Shogun Yoshimune," Nishida played the father Yoshimune TOKUGAWA and Baijaku played the first son Ieshige; in "Komyogatsuji," Nishida played the father Ieyasu TOKUGAWA and Baijaku played the third son Hidetada.)

In both of the TV dramas mentioned above, he played the son of Toshiyuki NISHIDA's character (in "The Eighth Shogun Yoshimune," Nishida played the father Yoshimune TOKUGAWA and Baijaku played the first son Ieshige; in "Komyogatsuji," Nishida played the father Ieyasu TOKUGAWA and Baijaku played the third son Hidetada).

In both of the TV dramas mentioned above, he played the son of Toshiyuki NISHIDA's character (in "The Eighth Shogun Yoshimune," Nishida played the father Yoshimune TOKUGAWA and Baijaku played the first son Ieshige; in "Komyogatsuji," Nishida played the father Ieyasu TOKUGAWA and Baijaku played the third son Hidetada).

sen.j: 両人は映画釣りバカ日誌でも共演しているが大河と取って代わり立場は逆転して梅雀＝上司役、西田＝部下浜崎役、である。
sen.e: The two actors also played together in the film "Tsuribaka nisshi" (Free and Easy), but in the film, the positions were reversed as Baijaku played the boss and Nishida played his subordinate Hamasaki.
The two actors also performed alongside each other in the film "Tsuribaka nisshi" (Free and Easy) but roles were reversed, Baijaku playing the boss and Nishida playing his subordinate Hamasaki.
The two actors also performed alongside each other in the film "Tsuribaka nisshi" (Free and Easy) but roles were reversed, Baijaku playing the boss and Nishida playing his subordinate Hamasaki.

sen.j: ピアニストだった母の影響で、幼いころからジャズに傾倒。

sen.e: Kankuro wrote the lyrics of a song based on this episode with Baijaku called 'Tokyo Medley' (in the album "Yome to Rokku" (My Wife and Rock)), performed by Group Tamashii.

sen.j: 子供の頃にエレキベースが欲しいと父親におねだりするが、歌舞伎に関係ないと一蹴される。
sen.e: When he was young, he asked his father to buy him an electric bass guitar, but his father dismissed him as 'the bass has nothing to do with Kabuki.'
When he was young, he asked his father to buy him an electric bass guitar, but his father dismissed the idea by saying that the bass has nothing to do with Kabuki.

sen.j: そこで三味線を改造してエレキ三味線を作り弾いていた。
sen.e: He then made an electric shamisen (a three-stringed Japanese banjo) by modifying a shamisen.

sen.j: 友達曰く「作ったのは凄いが、あまり格好良くない」との事。
sen.e: According to his friend, it was 'amazing that he actually made it, but it wasn't really a cool-looking instrument.'
